Of the cafeteria style dishes I love  the lasagna and the veal parmesan. 
As for the other stuff they have..OMG the philly cheese steak. It's probably not a real proper philly cheese steak since we're not in philly but so so tasty. Nino makes it fresh on the grill and pairs it with bread he bakes.
The pizza! Nino's pizza will ruin you for all other pizza. He makes his own dough and sauce. I've watched my hubs put away a whole  pizza all by himself and they are NOT small just very very good.  Nino actually knows the difference between stromboli and a calzone. Dat stromboli yo.

Extra parking on the side and rear. Does not take cards.

Mommy notes: Nino loves talking to kids. Always gives plenty of napkins. Small inside so leave the stroller in the car. Bring cash. Clean bathrooms.

Let's be real, Ben & Jerry's is a tried and true ice cream empire that we all know and love. We trust that each time we enter a store, no matter where it may be, we will get a consistent quality of delicious ice cream creations. BUT what sets this location apart is the awesome staff, always scooping with a smile and willing to help. Shout out to the awesome manager, Beth, and new scooper, Trenton! Yes, I know their names, and yes, I come here that often.

Love Texas Roadhouse!!!!  But lets be honest this Texan loves anything with the word Texas in the title!  When we are in the mood for steak and don't want to drive far this is our favorite choice in Avon!  Wish they had lunch hours during the week.  

Steaks are aways cooked exactly how we order them and the bread and honey butter are awesome!

Solid brunch place in Tucson. 

Let me preface this review by disclosing that my usual stomping grounds are Los Angeles and Scottsdale, the brunch capitals of the West.  And call me, #basic but I love brunch more than most things.  My friends and I came here because Prep and Pastry was way too crowded (1 hr wait, no thank you!) and Ghini's had none.  The interior is cute and French-themed with painted trellises, stained glass art, and artfully placed wine bottles, which would please any Francophile.

I ordered the carafe of Bloody Mary, which I really enjoyed!  We got it Nola style so it was spicy, and the alcohol content was on point.  For my entree I got the spinach, ham and swiss crepe.  Not mind blowing but definitely not bad. I had some of my friend's croque madame. also not bad.  The stand out of this meal was definitely the bloody mary.

They were more than happy to accommodate for all the outside requests we had.  One of my friends is notoriously picky and always customizes her order.  the servers at Ghini's took it in stride.

The best part of this cafe is that you can split the check really really easily!  I wish the brunch spots in LA would adopt this policy.  Added on a whole star for the ease of this payment scheme.  You just go to the front, tell the cashier what you ordered and you pay for it. 

There is also a bakery appended to the other side of the cafe.  They sell macarons, cookies, huge pull apart cinnamon rolls, and tarts.  The cookie I got was ok.

I can't believe I haven't written a review of R's since I have breakfast here several times. 

So here goes: first of all we both love this place, especially the outdoor dining (always breakfast). Secondly, the staff is super friendly and truly seems to care about the customer. Third - the food! Even though it is a somewhat limited menu, everything is excellent and usually more than I can eat. Finally, it is priced right!

Rembrandt's is our go to breakfast spot when we have out of town company because we believe they exhibit everything we like about the Treasure Valley.

I can't believe I haven't been here yet!  I had no idea how great this place was.  My friend and I enjoyed listening to some great music, and enjoyed great local drink options.  I had a sangria with basil and blackberry - it was excellent.  I love how there's a menu for each color of wine.  The bartender was informative, talking through what we would enjoy with us.  Excellent local whiskey, gin, beer and wine, and the bar was so different and flavorful!  We had house made chips and guacamole, and amazing tacos with a bacon-wrapped, chili stuffed with ground meat!!  Such a delightful experience!!

Nice charter boat ride when in the area. I had to say I was expecting more of a beautiful scenery while on the boat ride, however that didn't happen. Saw a lot of industrial factories and cargo ships passing by. Needless to say, it was still beautiful and a great time. I mean if you wanna catch up with friends and love ones on the water, please go! Make sure to purchase a LUNCH tix, it's the best. They make the best fried catfish. I ate that the whole two hours. Also, there's live jazz but I did care to see that-- happy sailing.

Ok so when I first reviewed Huddles, they decided to close 30 minutes early without warning - and since this was my first impression, it certainly was and is a lasting impression. While I don't find it professional, I decided to give it another go today. The yogurt was very tasty. On point as far as cost goes. Staff was friendly enough. One thing in particular that I liked is that 80% of the toppings are in individual containers which leaves less room for cross contamination... and germs. Loved the modern decor. If you're looking fire selection as far as yogurt flavors go though - it's no orange leaf or fro-yo.

I love Garbonzo's Pizza! This location is just as good as the Caldwell location! I ordered a small pizza this time and I was so happy that the toppings were just as plentiful! The staff was friendly! I ordered for dine in and had the place to myself. I noticed a sign outside that said "Pizza buffet lunch special $7.50(?) with drink. My cashier was really great about up selling. She almost convinced me to grab dessert to take home, apparently there is money bread for dessert! I can't wait to go back!

No exaggerating but these are awesome Northern Mexican style tacos for cheap. They do not disappoint and always taste a bit like mesquite wood which I love. There are lots of menu options to choose from and they do have hamburgers. Hamburgers, you say? At a taco joint? Who does that? I do! They taste like steak and mesquite as well and come on a toasty sesame seed bun with a lot of sesames and you can load it up with the Mexican toppings and make your own fusion burger. So this isn't just a taco joint, although the carne aside tacos are what I love the best. They also have great caramelos and Sonoran hot dogs.  This place does get pretty loud because they play music videos on the screen above so just know this before you go. 
***Also, they have a drive-through.

I thought Cucina Zapata was my well kept secret but it looks like the cat is out of the bag now.

Ever since I tried Cucina at the Vendy's, I've been amazed with their fusion cuisine and quality of food. When I found out that they were located in my part of town (UC), I was elated and immediately tracked them down!

What is not to love here? I've tried everything on their menu and they're all sooooo good! 

+Thai short rib or chicken satay taco ($3 a piece): great flavors, not too heavy, avocados aplenty, and delicious spicy mayo sauce
+Chicken Katsu ($5 + 50cents for egg): substantially-sized, crunchy chicken strips with rice, tomato chunks, and sesame seeds in tonkatsu sauce 
+Red veggie curry ($5): potato and pumpkin chunks with rice in a creamy curry broth, DELICIOUS. Spice level is perfect.
+Cap'n Crunch encrusted tilapia burrito($6): slightly sweet, crunchy, and flavorful; generously portioned. Don't miss out on this one!
+Mexican veggie burger ($4): I'm not a vegetarian but I really wouldn't miss meat if I could eat this daily. Love the spicy mayo!
+Thai ice tea/thai green tea ($2): refreshing, not too sweet, waaay better than starbucks

Owners are super gracious and friendly. They really care about their customers since they make an effort to engage in conversation with you.

Only downsides:
-Some of their menu choices take a long time like the Tilapia, especially during the lunch rush (~15 minute wait) but totally worth it
-Random closings. I've been here a couple of times only to find them closed. A few weeks ago, I dragged my friend after class to try my favorite food truck. We were so disappointed that we trekked all the way from Penn only to find Cucina to be closed. I wish they were a bit more consistent with their schedule.

All in all, Cucina Zapata is a safe bet for an affordable and delicious meal. I'm a huge fan!

Goodies:
- 5 walking minutes away from Harrah's Casinos. Convenient spot for many attractions. 
- Free breakfast- eggs, waffles, fruit, cereal, toast, yogurt, etc. 
- Friendly staff. 
- Access to computers. 
- The room was wonderful. There is a kitchen and living room space. The bed was very comfy. It's perfect for spending many hours there after you have lost $$$ at Harrah's. Cry away in this amazing bed. 

Neg: 
- There were still trash leftover from the previous guest. I don't think it's that hard to dump it out. 
- The curtains were so odd. There are two layers- light, airy curtain and heavy duty curtain that is suppose to protect you from the sun. The heavy duty curtain is not movable and does not cover the entire window. Why is this important? I was so freakin' tired this morning and wanted my sleep but the damn sun woke me up. I got up to move the curtain but was surprised that I couldn't. I woke up at 7:10am and couldn't go back to sleep. 
- I loved the breakfast BUT my milk was spoiled. Gross. 
- Parking overnight is $25. I went to Harrah's and played penny slots for 30 minutes. If you play for 30 minutes using a Total Rewards card, Harrahs' will validate your parking for 24 hours. 
- $4 for one condom at the downstairs convenience store. Just sayin' if you're feeling frisky.

Al's is a landmark in Plainfield. The shop is small with 3 tables, loyal locals and the girls behind the counter could not be friendlier or nicer. You need to drive behind Dairy Queen to get to the parking lot. It's worth the trip if your close to Plainfield but get here EARLY. The donuts are delicious. I don't care for cake donuts but our server said I was passing up one of the best. So of course I topped off our dozen with those. They were light, fluffy cake donuts topped with a rich, dark chocolate icing. Thank you for that recommendation! 

They, like many small shops, sell till their gone. At 8:30 the tables were full of locals visting over coffee, enjoying donuts. The cases were close to empty with folks hurry in to grab what remained in the case. I now understand why Al's donuts are a staple for all these years. Even though Al has retired, the shop still honors and respects his love for donuts. He has a new fan as of today's first donut.

My friends and I searched out Crystal BBQ with Korean Ribs in mind. That was all I wanted - some delicious korean ribs and some kimchi. We went into Crystal BBQ with fairly low expectations and came out happy.

We didn't even look at the menu - we ended up having the all you can eat barbeque dinner, which was basically just every meat they could possibly offer, cooked right in front of you. The restaurant was dead, so we had one server all to ourselves (mostly) all night to help facilitate the cooking process, as cooking on the crystal bbq was tricky (as was figuring out which meats were which, and which were cooked or not!). The menu was huge, the waitress was very friendly and just said she would bring out a little of everything and we could try what we wanted before we ordered more. We barely made it through our "try" of everything before we were bursting at the seams. Tons of korean beef, beef ribs, pork, bacon, marinated chicken, shrimp, you name it, we had it. And it was actually REALLY good.

Along the piles of meats, they also served up korean dishes like kimchi, potatos, salads, veggies and steamed rice. The cost was very good, I think it ended up being something like $18 a person, including soft drinks. 

The restaurant is located in a rather shifty area of downtown, just east of the court houses and slightly north of Jasper. It's fairly nice inside and the staff were very accommodating and friendly. I can't speak for the rest of the menu, but all of the meats we had in our dinner were seasoned just right and were super delicious. If you are looking to try out a variety of korean barbeque, I definitely recommend Crystal.

ONE RECOMMENDATION I HAVE: When this place gets busy and all the tables are cooking meats, the whole place can get very warm/greasy very fast. I don't recommend making this your go-to date place or dropping in for a meal before going anywhere important, because you walk out completely drenched in the smell of the restaurant. Just a tip. If you have dogs, they'll love you when you come home, if you know what I mean.

This is one of our favorite spots to go wine tasting in Santa Barbara. It is a little touristy just because of the location (out on the pier) but as soon as you go upstairs to the tasting room all it is easy to forget where you are. The view is amazing. You can take your wine tasting out on the patio and just venture back in when you are ready for your next pour. The inside is lovely too, nice couches and seating + it is a little cooler on a hot day and warmer on a cool day to sit inside. 

The wine is really good. I've done both the regular tasting and the reserve and enjoyed all of the wine. Pro tip: 2-for-1 tastings with the Axxess Pass. 

There is a restroom in the tasting room and also a public restroom on the pier. The pier also has parking but it is an easy walk out to the Deep Sea Tasting room from the main streets of downtown Santa Barbara, so no need to move your car if you are already parked in the area.

This restaurant's rating probably suffers a bit more than it should because I was expecting to be wowed and I wasn't. Anyway, the interior is gorgeous, I love the fresh flowers and the walls of pickled vegetables.

The have a fantastic cocktail list, in fact, if i ever come back, it will be to sit at the bar and have a drink, albeit a very expensive one.  My appetizer, pork belly with a shaved vegetable salad, was very good and dressed with an incredible vinaigrette. My BF had something else that I forgot as it wasn't very memorable. As far as entrees, they all sounded fine but nothing really grabbed me. I ordered the pork, which was okay. The only standout was a fried sweet potato patty it was served with. Besides what I thought to be a not very inspired menu, the plate presentation was weak. Everything was the same color. I know that's nitpicky but it's an expensive place and I want the food to look and taste beautiful.

Our desserts (creme bruleee and a chocolate cake) were very rich, too rich for my boyfriend so I was forced to finish them for us.  No espresso, I really hate that at nice restaurants. French press is good but it's not espresso, plus it was so weak I could practically see through it.  I wasn't displeased with our dinner but I would much rather go somewhere else for the amount of money we paid.

big fan. big big fan of Fill A Bagel.
I have to confess for as much as I tease my husband for being a predictable orderer I get the same items repeatedly at Fill A Bagel.
and they are:
great grain toasted with veggie cream cheese on the side, it's a "lite" cream cheese, but I can't tell, it's too good to be lite.
I will occasionally want a warm breakfast which is when I get the great grain with egg and cheddar. the egg is microwaved, which is typical of a lot of take out breakfast places.
lunch - great grain again! (I usually get everything bagels, but F a Bagel uses more salt than I prefer, no matter I love their great grain)
toasted with either the new jenkintowner, which is turkey, green bell pepper slices, romaine lettuce, swiss cheese and honey mustard (and maybe onion and tomato? I forget.
OR the tempting tuna. tunafish, hot cherry peppers, lettuce and again maybe tomato and onion. delish!
it's not super cheap. but good food made fresh rarely is. or should be.

Oh my Joy, the Children's Museum!!!!!!!!!! When was the last time I even went here??? I have no idea ! I've missed every Adult Swim event over the past three years and I don't have children, so I don't come properly equipped to handle loads of kids running, screaming and living their lives as I infiltrate my adult desires to play in a museum created for THEM! So I stay away. 

But thanks to Yelp and Sacred Journeys, I was able to go experience a taste of #TCM! I had a great time and I hope they are planning to do it again, as I will be back.

Sacred Journeys started off with a complimentary drink token, to which I indulged in some red wine. From there, the open bar was $5 for drinks (Im not sure if it was an all inclusive price...they had Sun King beer and wine). There was small table with lightweight snacks for dining, but the food and drinks were not allowed into the exhibit. Pretzels, chips, hummus and pita bread, fried wontons and spinach artichoke dip and some mini pizza bagels lined up the table for guests to cure their stomach rumblings. I admit to over indulging on the pizza bites.

I unfortunately only saw two of the exhibits, which means they either have to do this again OR I will have to go on my own and deal with the big laugh & play time of the children. Seeing two of the exhibits and not even in their full capacity just opened up the Pandora Children's Museum Box that now says I MUST SEE MORE!!!!! 

I visited Sacred Journeys, which is really incredible, interactive exhibit about five different areas of the world that people journey off to in order to celebrate their  religion. The long corridor that leads you into the exhibit has a looped video playing that gives you the synopsis of what you will see. Once you turn the corner, all colors of religion, spirituality and love shining. They even had the throne that the Dali Lama sat on in a glass encasing. Pretty cool ! I didn't see the entire exhibit as I was called away but what I did see, I loved !!! I love that the kids have a space that teaches them ABOUT religion and the differences in people, all while showing some of the most beautiful parts of the world. 

The other exhibit I checked out was the Beijing exhibit which comes complete with a replica airplane that flies you into the Beijing while you feel the vibrations of the chair and see the amazing sights that you would see out your window if you were really flying. Once you get off the plane, an entire world opened up ! There was everything, themed and precise, including a grocery store, a Saigon theater, a house, restaurant and much much more. You are really allowed an authentic experience of life in Beijing if you were to travel there. Me and my group had a ball in this area playing dress up, taking pictures and learning to write calligraphy and say hello in native tongue.

Upon leaving, we were asked to sign up on their email list. The ladies told us there would be more of these events in the future! I can't wait and hope they don't change their mind because what adult would not want to take a break from working and paying bills to go unwind with a glass of wine at the Children's Museum and be a kid all over again....in the midst of other adults !!!!

So, I hate to be a nay-sayer in the homogeneous list of 5-star reviews, but at this point, I find Village Whiskey just "A-OK".  That's not a bad thing, but I was decidedly underwhelmed.  I had been hearing the burger raves for months, but had also heard about the 2-hour waits.  I had been waiting for just the perfect occasion, and it came on a random Wednesday afternoon at 3:30 while entertaining an out of town friend.  

Garces has done a very nice job with the space, and has achieved a classy, old-school bar vibe.  The tiles and woodwork are beautifully restored, the mirrors are antiqued to perfection, most of the light fixtures are charming.  In light of how-well designed everything else seemed to be, the cheap white metal fluorescent fixtures above the bar with label glue still staining them stood out like sore thumbs.  But I digress . . .

We claimed a primo table by the bar and set out to enjoy the "best burger in Philly".  Our waiter was very friendly, helpful with beer selections, and solicitous without being intrusive.  My friend went with the burger as described on the menu; I added cheddar.  We split an order of duck fat fries and washed it all down with beer.  To get right down to business, the burgers (both ordered medium) were good.  They were so good that I did not even mind paying $10 for them.  However, they were NOT the best burgers in Philly.  Both were slightly overcoooked, and the meat, while juicy, would have benefited from a bit more salt or seasoning.  If I had waited 2 hours for the experience, I would have been right pissed.  The duck fat fries were very good - crunchy on the outside, redolent with duck fat flavor, and filled with fluffy potato-y goodness.  Though the order looked on the small side, they were rich enough that the two of us could not finish them.

I expect I will be back to Village Whiskey.  I really dug the vibe, and I saw some intriguing cocktails being prepped with tender-loving-care at the bar.  I was entranced by the shaving of limes and muddling of herbs.  Speaking of cocktails, I ordinarily loves me some whiskey and the list at Village was pretty spectacular.  It makes it all the more sad that I will probably not be having any of them there.  The mark-ups were fairly ridiculous, especially since good whiskey does not really require any Iron Chef magic.

So fortunate to have a local walgreens with staff that is very friendly and helpful. If I can't find something there is always a cheery walgreens staff ready to help. I do appreciate them and love walgreens convenience and prices in their sales papers

Mr. B's is an all round really good dining experience.  They quickly found us a table for two.  Although it was in the shipping lanes, Len was our server, and he handled us with warm professionalism.  

For appetizers we had the yummy fried oysters and the rich and wonderful gumbo.  Both were incredible.

I ordered the shrimp and grits and they were better than any I have had in Charleston.  GF had the garlic chicken and found it to be a bit salty (and she loves salt).  That was the only flaw in the evening.

She had Profiteroles And Chocolate Sauce and  whiskey for desert!  Great meal.

Well I finally checked out this pet store the other day and picked up a few things.  I like supporting some of the independent business's when I can.

Man the dogs love this place.  So much to spoil them with they can barely focus :)  Lots of tougher to find foods that are locally sourced as well as some imports as well.  A pretty big selection of grooming supplies, dog houses, carriers etc.  

Knowledgeable staff and average pricing.  The odd thing seams cheaper and some things perhaps not so much.

Overall some things I will come and buy here and more closely a 3.5.  Perhaps a four once I really dive in and peruse the inventory!

Great shop! They have a lot of Specialized bikes at good prices--women's Vita was around $400. Definitely check them out if you are looking for a new bike. 

The guys are super friendly. The staff always offers to help when you walk in. I was looking for a rear rack basket (incredibly hard to find) and they had one style in stock. It wouldn't fit over my Topeak rack so the guy back in the mechanics shop cut away some of the springs so that it would fit over it, free of charge. I love that they are super accommodating and want to make sure everything works for you.

I wish my review was better. I really wanted to find a gem here. 
Places to sit inside and out along the loop. 
Has a older look to it but clean. 
We had not heard of this place but we love NYC pizza and we're excited to maybe get to have a taste of it once again. 
The waitress said it would be cheaper to order by the slice so we did. We got bacon and sausage. 
It came loaded!!! So much in each slice we could have used it on two more slices. 
Sadly this was not NYC pizza. The crust was hard. Too hard to fold it in half. Hardly any cheese. I want crazy about the flavor but my daughter likes it. The pieces were so big we couldn't finish them make the cost quit a deal. 
Not a place I'd visit again but not too bad.

I agree with both the good and bad reviews on here.  I think the trick is in ordering.  There are a few standouts and also a few things that should be left alone but if you stick with the tried and true favorites, you'll do just fine.  That would be oysters on the half shell (especially during 50 cent happy hour) and French 75s.  Perfect way to end a long day!  The pork rillette is also phenomenal, I realize I might as well just spread it directly on my love handles rather than eat it but sometimes you just have to indulge, right?  Make sure you let it sit for a few minutes to come to room temp and that's when it gets really good.

Boudin noir, not so great, cochon sandwich, fine but not worth repeating and the Choucroute Maison kind of made me feel like Fred Flinstone.  I have had really indifferent (bartenders) and even downright rude (hostesses) but mostly I just find the servers there either preoccupied, unknowledgeable or overly busy. But I don't go for service, just those perfectly mixed cocktails and briny, cool oysters!

The coffee is delicious.  No matter where I am in the city, I look for La Colombe when I want coffee.

My review is for the coffee, for the roasters.  

My review for the coffeehouse off Rittenhouse Square?  One star.  I will not go in there again.  At La Colombe, they must train their staff to look down their noses at customers and be curt and rude. I agree with previous reviews about the "euro-snobbery."  Too bad, because I like this location and love their coffee

Had a great breakfast at Puckett's yesterday. I got the Leiper's Fork Favorite which is really quite a steal for the price. Two huge pancakes (took half of them home to enjoy for breakfast the next day.) 

 And the Benton's Bacon was perfectly cooked. The eggs were over medium, which sounds simple but you would be amazed at the variation I get when I order my eggs. Some people just don't know how to do over medium eggs. 

I "upgraded" (an additional dollar) to sweet potato pancakes and was very glad I did. I love sweet potatoes but sometimes restaurants over do it when making sweet potato things (the bright orange color is always a dead giveaway that this is the case.)However, to my delight Puckett's sweet potato pancakes came out and were a golden brown color. Had they forgotten the sweet potato? Nope, there was a distinct sweet potato flavor in the pancakes and just a hint of cinnamon and nutmeg. Very well done. 

The staff was friendly and helpful. Yesterday's weather was crazy, so I started sitting outside and ended up having to move inside when the rain started getting the pages of my book wet. They accommodated my mid meal move well. 

Also my coffee cup was never less than half way full. Which is a much early mornings. I will def be back for breakfast. Will have to try it out for dinner.

Amazing. Loved this place! First of all, they allow dogs inside and second their bouquet latte was so so good. I got it with oat milk instead of normal milk and I think it tasted better. The latte was so pretty too! They have dried flowers on it for decoration. Super unique and yummy will be back!!

THE place to go to if you are in the bywater, love music, and can't wait to drink some wine. I love this place probably more than any other place in NOLA. There's nothing like relaxing outside with a glass of wine while a band plays. I've only been at night and look forward to a day when I can go for lunch. I've had the cheese plate before it was great. I just wish parking was easier.

I love me some Jackson's.  It's one of those places that can be suggested for a meal and then I can immediately taste the exact food that I will be ordering.  In this case, it's the Rio roll torrado with the chop salad.  Food styles and prices vary significantly between menu items so there really is something for everyone.  They've also got an extensive drink menu.  As for desserts, I absolutely love the gooey butter cake.  I've had many good times sitting with friends on their outdoor patio, and one of my favorite things about the interior, aside from the wine on the wall and the beautiful artwork, is the fact that on pretty days they open the garage doors so that the whole place has a breeze.  This place definitely has a very distinctive culture in addition to delicious food, making it one of my favorite Nash-Vegas places to take out of town visitors.

Love this place. The outdoor area is like a huge backyard with lights strung up and a small stage in front with live music. There are a bunch of tables and communal seating. Everyone seems super friendly and its easy to join another table with empty seats. Ordering wine/cocktails is easy at bar outside or upstairs.

I really enjoy Heads and Tails Beauty Boutique.  I have been going here for the past 2 years about every 2-3 weeks to have my eyebrows waxed and get a Brazilian every so often. Waxing is always somewhat painful, but it is much less so here since they use the blue wax that is great for more sensitive skin.  The prices are  maybe slightly higher than some places in the immediate area, but this place is so great that it is worth it.  You get fantastic customer service as well. Everyone that I have met who works here is super friendly and look like they want to be there/enjoy what they do.  Lori B. is who I always go to.  I love her!  She is so personable, and always gives me a great wax.

I have had pretty bad experiences (at other salons) with waxing in the past (especially with the bikini area), but Lori always makes me feel so comfortable and relaxed that every experience here is a great one! 

I really like the fact that Heads and Tails only offers certain services...you cant go here for every single thing that you can possibly get in a salon, which is nice because it keeps things smaller and more personal. They specialize in what they do and I like that I know when I get there that each person who works here know what they are doing  and do it very well.

I hope to try some of their other services soon!

Pralines and Peanut Butter!!

Review my photos and you'll see that my wish-list line of sweets include peanut butter, peanut butter, and more peanut butter.  Yes, I love me some peanut butter and it wasn't until now, that I enjoy a good praline once in awhile too.  We stopped at Southern Candymakers not once, but twice, during our weekend stay in New Orleans.  This only means that we wanted more and more is exactly what I got. 

What to expect...
-Southern Candymakers has entrances on both sides.  I prefer that you walk through the Decatur Street side. From there, you're immediately in line to the register.  Make up your mind quick because the line goes quick. 
 
-The Selection...all sorts of goodness.  Chocolates galore!  As you get to the register, you'll get to the Pralines.  Some of the best pralines are found here.  

-Pre-Boxed Treats

-Souvenirs

My Selections:  Peanut Butter dominates my choices.  I'm sure the other chocolates were good, but it's all about the nutty taste of PB for me.  Love their PB Pralines, PB covered Oreo's, and the PB Pretzel.  All PB cups were a little too much for me to handle.

-Peanut Butter Praline:  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=uTva7BqdYwI3JfN8eY5OsA&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ

-Peanut Butter Covered Oreo Cookies:  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=jN748Nb2T6S-mletDtm8wA&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ

-Peanut Butter Chocolate Pretzel:  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=ELiAwzEGyDkvWPYxac0JOw&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ

-Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup:  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=3Yinlqhp2O-Hw5OO5VeSjw&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ

-White Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup:  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Ch3Sm7fF-vBcjzosWb_DDA&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ

-Peanut Butter Passion Cup:  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=BFNVDZvRgAGHoi1QHkGj2Q&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ

Overall, I'm giving Southern Candymakers 4 Stars for service, selection of sweets, the abundance of peanut butter choices, quality, and taste.  The only thing keeping me from giving them 5 Stars is price.  $2.50 for one peanut butter cup?!?!  


PS:  Read Terri R's review.  She's right, you are hit with the sweet smell of sugar.  You can even smell it from outside.  Need to wake up..try walking inside Southern Candymakers. If the smell of freshly made chocolates or peanut butter doesn't wake you up, then you must be made of stone.




YELP PERSONAL CHALLENGE - (033/366)

I was eager to try Toppers after reading the pretty stellar reviews. My family ordered the Toppers Classic (pepperoni, Italian sausage, onions, green peppers with mozzarella and homemade pizza sauce) and a create your own (spinach, artichoke hearts, feta, black olives), both on thin crust. A large 14" pizza is $18.99, and they also come in 9", 12" and 16".

Ordering online was a cinch and the pizza was ready to go when we went to pick it up 20 minutes later. 

I enjoyed our pizzas (my personal fave was the Toppers Classic), but neither were OMG ah-mazing. Their pizza offerings are more gluttonous (think mac n' cheese pizza and lots of BBQ/ranch concoctions) and I tend to like the "healthier" pizzas, like veggie lovers. A solid choice but not at the top of my list.

I love this hotel. I stayed here for a night with some friends who were visiting Nashville. It reminds me of a hotel that should be in NYC - so modern, beautiful, and elegant! Our room was very clean, beds were cozy (we didn't want to get out of them), and the room was so pretty. It's located downtown so you are pretty much in walking distance to everything that you want/need. The staff was great - helpful if we had any questions/needs. Definitely one of my favorite hotels in Nashville!
I love this place. Best burgers in Nashville. The service is also great. A place for a great meal !

My mom and I ventured to NOLA for a girls weekend (first time for both of us). I found Hotel Mazarin on Trip Advisor's website. The hotel was highly rated with awesome reviews and I decided to book! The hotel does fill up fast and I'd recommend booking sooner than later.

When we arrived our room was not ready but we received free drink tickets for the bar and headed up for a glass of wine. Cute bar attached to the restaurant with a nice small outside sitting area.

Room: We opted for a courtyard room (street views tend to be very noisy especially on the weekend). Lovely room with 2 queen beds and granite bathroom. We could hear noise from the courtyard on Saturday night (there was a wedding) but the other nights were quite peaceful.

All staff are friendly and helpful. Major props to Janet the concierge. She gave us great dinner ideas (Tableau and GW Fins) and set us up for a plantation half day tour.

The restaurant is around the corner from Bourbon Street and walking distance to the church and Mississippi river.

I highly recommend this hotel if you are willing to spend a little extra money. The staff, great buffet breakfast with courtyard seating and free wifi make up for the cost in my opinion.

I love my little Rite Aid, from cadbury cream eggs to eyliner pen and cotton buds, saves me the trip into Kroger and is a lot faster.  The staff are super friendly and polite and the Pharmacy girls totally organised.

Yum! Talk about a really lovely margarita. A peach margarita made from FRESH PEACHES FROM THE FARMERS MARKET. 

My colleague Julie P also had a finely crafted drink. Scotch, whiskey, I can't remember, but it had a zing of yumminess which was perfect after a hot day of attempted scooter touring.

Do give Burger Up a try. The name had me thinking it was some burger diner, but that's not the case. It's a modern/industrial cafe with uber fresh food and drinks.

Marrakesh is all about creating an experience, and sadly that experience is one I would prefer to never have again. 

I went with my bf, his parents, our close friend and her parents and friends to Marrakesh. She chose the restaurant, having been there before, and chose the 8:30pm seating time for our party of 10. The restaurant is located off of South Street on this almost alley-like street, and the moment you walk in you grasp the concept they're trying to throw out at you: a traditional Moroccan-style meal in a setting that's supposed to mimic Moroccan interiors, with loud Middle Eastern style music (that sounded like the Slumdog Millionaire soundtrack). Rugs are everywhere, on the floor and wall, and you sit on low couches or cushion stools around round tables. 

The meal is a 7 course prix fixe $35 per person (no a la carte menu), although they do have vegetarian alternatives to the meat dishes. The only menu they hand you is the drinks menu, which ranges from beer to wine to rose water to Coca cola. The menu is as follows:

First course: 3 salads, eggplant, tomato-cucumber, and carrot
Second course: phyllo pastry filled with chicken and egg with powdered sugar and cinnamon on top. Vegetarian alternative is without chicken, just egg.
Third course: Whole chicken, slow-cooked, either mild or spicy (we asked for spicy sauce on the side). Vegetarians get a lentil dish.
Fourth course: Either honey lamb or beef shish kebabs, we asked for both. Vegetarians have a spinach-filled rolled pastry.
Fifth course: Couscous topped with chicken, raisins, and vegetables. No chicken for vegetarians.
Sixth course: Fresh fruit bowl
Seventh course: mint tea and baklava.

The meal was awful from the start. They sat us all the way at the top floor, in the back - we're pretty sure they continuously forgot about us throughout the meal. Our waiter looked like he was in high school, and it took him 15 minutes to get our drinks (only 4 people ordered anything); in the mean time, the music was so obnoxiously loud we could barely talk to one another, let alone the people next to us, and the air conditioning was so high that I was shivering - and I was wearing a sweater! - and even after asking them to turn it down, it was STILL cold.

Considering that its a prix fixe menu, you would expect the food to come out quickly, but we waited about 45 minutes for the first course, which isn't even cooked! Our waiter was not attentive in general, and each course took far too long to come out (he also took forever to realize we were done with each dish). The food overall was not good - edible, but where were the spices? The FLAVOR?! My bf said the lamb was good, but otherwise we were all very disappointed in the dishes. And there was waaaay too much food, we felt bad towards the end because of all the wasted food since we could barely have more than a bite of the later courses. The fruit plate mostly went into people's purses. I was most disappointed by the baklava, which was truly awful just phyllo pastry and honey WHERE WERE THE NUTS?! I'm Greek, I love baklava and this was awful. 

Perhaps the worst part of the evening, after suffering through awful service, bad food and too much of it, obnoxious atmosphere (which includes a belly dancer going around to each table), the waiter brings the bill and tells us AT THAT MOMENT that they take cash or check but NOT credit cards. They didn't tell us when we made the reservations, they didn't tell us at the beginning of the meal to allow us to run to a bank and get money, they had the audacity to tell us right at the end. I thought he was joking, but no. We managed to pool enough cash together, but the entire experience was not worth it and I will NEVER go back there. If this restaurant is about creating an experience, all they did was create a bad one.

I am so thrilled that we finally have Korean BBQ in Pinellas County. We had Korean BBQ in Winter Park once before and I was hoping it would make it to our area. 66 Q-Pot lived up to our expectations. 

Current prices: 
Hot Pot $22.99  (Sort of like fondue..you cook your food in broth)
Korean BBQ $26.99 (You cook your food on a grill that is in the table) 
Combination of both $29.99

We decided to go all out and do both for our first visit. Honestly, we will probably stick to Korean BBQ in future visits. We liked the meat and the end result much better on the grill than we did the items cooked in broth. 

For the Hot Pot, you pick your broth, meats/seafood and veggies/noodles. You are able to pick more than one broth. We tried the original and spicy. I don't recommend the spicy because while it had a good flavor, it was oily from all the added chili oil. We went with udon noodles, potatoes, beef and pork and mushrooms. The meat comes rolled up and is blanched in the liquid for a quick cook. There is not a lot of flavor to this style of cooking, which is why we liked the bbq better. 

For the Korean BBQ, we had quite a few different items. We liked the black pepper steak, pork belly and the curry chicken probably the best out of everything we tried. However, there wasn't really anything we didn't like on the Korean BBQ side. We also tried corn, mushrooms and onions. None of these came out great on the grill, but you need a little something with your meat. 

They also have a really awesome sauce and seasoning bar (try the special soy sauce..it's great) and a small accompaniment bar that has lettuce for wraps, kimchi, fruit, desserts, etc. I grilled some pineapple which was delicious. We also seasoned and sauced all the meat we cooked which brought it to another level. The only thing I really wished that they had different were some rice at the bar (or a bowl brought out with the meats). It would also be a good idea to have mushrooms and onions on the bar instead of having to order them each round. 

Overall, we left really happy and full. This is definitely a fun and interactive eating experience. We loved it and we will return.

This place rocks! Came here on a Sunday night and probably waited about 15 minutes for a table. Loved the atmosphere and the waiters' attire, it's very old NOLA like. Don't come here for service 'cuz it is slow. In their defense, this place is always packed so I imagine things get backed up.

I was really eyeing their special that night, but once we ordered it, it was already sold out! So I opted for the chicken livers as my entree (even though it's listed under appetizer, that thing is huge) and ordered a side of collard greens and cornbread. My husband started with a cup of gumbo, which was just ok and then had the meatloaf plate, which was not a very big plate, surprisingly. After gulping his down, he started helping me out with mine, and said I had the better dish! Even with him helping me, we didn't finish the whole dish so we took it to go and it was our snack the next day. Being stuffed from dinner didn't prevent us from ordering dessert. We shared a peach cobbler but we weren't too impressed by it.

Next time, I will have to try the fried chicken and bread pudding!!

Bought my candles last week and have loved them! I actually wish I was home more so that I could burn them more often than I do! I will be buying candles for Christmas gifts for people in my office and family members as well AND I really want to make candles with the candle making parties they offer. 

Will be back for sure and will recommend to anyone and everyone.

Lucky Garden is super cheap. They do a lot of substitutions and don't get mad. They love throwing in free drinks here and there. But I really only have one thing that I can think about when it comes to Lucky Garden, despite they're food being so yummy---

I haven't had Pork Fried Rice of this quality in 15 years. Incredibly good.

Honestly, I had half a mind to write a really nasty review because the way they talk to and about phone customers is unpleasant... but the pork fried rice made me forget until just now.

Oh. my. god. I am madly in love with this place! I had been there for dinner once before and adored it, but I always wanted to return for brunch, since I heard excellent things about Kanella's brunch. My brunch experience this morning solidified Kanella's place in my heart forever. It is probably in my top 5 favorite restaurants in all of Philadelphia, since the dishes here have been consistently fresh and flavorful. The food manages to be rich, complex, and filling yet surprisingly light. 

I had family visiting from out of town, and I wanted to take my family to somewhere unique instead of a typical brunch spot with all the predictable items. Kanella's brunch menu is creative, and integrates some lunch and dinner items with more traditional breakfast mainstays like fried eggs. To start, we got freshly pressed coffee and the dips of the day. The dips impressed right off the bat. The baba ganoush and hummus were perfectly garlicky and lemony. Our favorite was a blend of carrots, feta, and some other delicious ingredients I really wish I could remember (facepalm). The grape leaves on the Kanella platter were among the best I've ever had. The rice was well-textured, and the grape leaves avoided being overly oily and mushy, a grape leaf pitfall I've experienced in the past. My dad had the most breakfast-y item out of all of us, which was the stewed tomato and onion shakshouka served with eggs and crispy bread. He enjoyed it greatly and described it as a fresh variation on huevos rancheros. The haloumi here is the best I've ever had. 

I was very happy in my decision to take an out-of-towner here, and I will keep it in mind  when I need to impress my next Philly visitor! Oh, and did I mention it's relatively affordable and also a BYOB? Win.

Kelly's Chick a Boom Room started off as our dinner spot as a lot of places nearby had stopped serving, but this spot still offered dinner. We ended up staying for several hours and hanging out after dinner.

One side is like a formal dining room and the other side had a bar, a DJ and lots of people dancing and having fun. There was also a huge outdoor patio. 

We started with a cheese board. We added pimento cheese which cost less than $5, and was worth it! We enjoyed all the items on the cheese board. For my main course I ordered coconut curried mussels. They were piping hot, fresh and delicious. 

It was Saturday night and the place was hoppin. There was a characterture artist who drew a lovely picture of myself, my niece and my girlfriend, along with one of the staff members we met that night.

I don't think we could have found a better spot in Dunedin to hang on a Saturday night!

The update to my review reflects my recent conversation with business owner Pike. Not only was he willing to remedy and address bartender on his approach towards patrons inquiries. 

I was invited back to make sure this time around my experience withstood the highest expectations that the Tolteca family has of its staff and products.

Unfortunately Im not a local and will need to take a rain check on that offer. But do appreciate the effort on managements behalf to ensure customers are happy. 

Love the effort!

I just moved from Seattle and I was just so happy to find an indie coffee shop! This place is lovely: battered leather chairs and couches, old hardwood floors, big beautiful windows with lots of natural light. There's a community bulletin board, which is one of the things that I love and actively seek out in indie places.

I can't speak to the coffee, but I had a great chai latte. They brew the chai concentrate themselves! They only have soy as far as non-dairy milks go, but that's probably normal outside of Seattle.

This is a really comfortable coffee shop with a friendly staff and an interesting menu. Hopefully I'll be able to come back soon.

Chef Crush!

I've had a crush on this chef for years, well his food anyway!  I've never met him.  My husband and I have visited Red Pony many times and I'm always impressed as the food is fabulous!  Our last visit was on my birthday.  We started with the dynamite lobster roll for our appetizer.  We have also had the handmade guacamole in the past.  I highly recommend both to start your meal.  I seem to always order the evening's special.  Halibut special for my big birthday dinner.  The most memorable special I've had here was something I had never heard of and definitely never eaten. It was called Piedmontese.   It is a breed of cattle from the region of Piedmont in north-west Italy.  It was the best steak I've ever put in my mouth.  I was too full for dessert so I got it to go.  The Truffle Indulgence was dark chocolate ganache, peanut butter, and goo goo cluster.  What's not to love?  

The entire staff is always very friendly and do everything they can to make your dinner very enjoyable.  They are truly glad you are there to dine with them.  The waiters do an amazing job describing the specials which is the main reason I have to try them.  I love this place because the food is fabulous!  If I keep dining here maybe I will get the pleasure of meeting Chef Jason McConnell one day.

I've always had a great time whenever I've been here. The exhibits are always extremely informative and well laid out. I love science but that's not the only thing you will find here! Admission isn't expensive and you can make a great day or date out of a visit here. I came here on Canada a couple years back and the boyfriend and I had fun going through all the exhibits... except the bug exhibit. I hate bugs. Anyways, the staff are friendly and will tell what you need to know about the exhibit. Beware of the gift store though, it's over-priced. There have been a couple exhibits I've missed out on for sure, but I will definitely be back!

Really good Japanese food! Love the sushi combo platters. The miso soup ,salad are basic; but fresh & tasty as is the shrimp shumai.
Nice atmosphere and good service. This place gets very busy and the parking lot can be a bit hard to navigate.
BYOB

My bestie and I decided to eat here after a long night of bar hopping lol. We were looking at restaurants that stayed open 24/7 and luckily they did! So we arrived around 3:00am in the morning and it wasn't that crowded at all, the service was kind of slow for a small group of people. I ordered the chicken and waffles and my bestie ordered the appetizer sampler. Overall my food was good it was a little on the cold side however the waffles was crisp, buttery and flavorful and I always love their variety of syrups. The service was just ok and the restaurant had a little bit of an odor and because of that they get two stars.

Federal Donuts is a must when you come to Philly!

There are some old fashion & fancy donuts! So many different flavors! Come early to try the good flavors because they run out by the end of the day! The donuts are delicious, warm, and fluffy. They make them on premises and you can watch! This location is big with plenty of seating! I still haven't tried their fried chicken though. :( Staff here are amazing and friendly! Love Federal Donuts!

Every time I come here I feel like I just stepped off the plane into Paris. From top to bottom, every detail was thoroughly thought out and meticulously chosen. This darling establishment has the most charming atmosphere! I lay awake at night dreaming of the Marie Antoinette macarons (go lemon or raspberry!) I've met a dessert here that I didn't love. The red velvet cake... Ohhhh my. Spring for a pot of tea with your dessert (only $6.) Perfect place for meeting the girls for sweets, gossip, drinks and laughs.

I drove by Noire thinking I needed a nap and then I realized I could get some much needed love on my feet and relax so I stopped in. 
This place has only been open a week and it's super nice and clean. The staff is great and friendly. 
I got the spa pedicure which is $27. They are offering $10 off for their grand opening on services over $30. 
I left feeling rested and pampered, exactly what I needed on a Friday afternoon.

I've never been in this store before but it's really cool. The employees are really nice and helpful. They go into detail regarding the products, ask about your current routine, what are your allergies and what you're looking to improve. I love the various displays throughout the store, but my absolute favorite is the face mask bar, it's like the salad bar in the grocery store but better. They offer a wide variety of mask for all skin types with natural ingredients. I tried a couple of their products on my hand with an employee who went over the benefits of the products while we waited the 10 minutes for the prodcuts to do its thang before she rinsed my hand in the large bowl of warm water and then dried it. It was a true experience sitting at the mask bar. 

They have hair, skin and bath products. I didn't even get a chance to get over to checkout the hair mask as I walked around. They also have some perfume scents available. The prices aren't bad. It's a busy store for sure with interesting products.

I LOVE Christiana Mall since they have revamped it and added some new stores.  They have all of the great things one needs in a mall with none of the sales tax!  It's also surrounded by a lot of great errand stores like Costco, Dick's, Michael's, and more!  You can pretty much get all of your shopping done in this area.

My favorite store in here is The Limited, I always get the best customer service there.  They have a huge H&M and a great J.C. Penny.  I also appreciate that there is a Target right in the mall!  

Convenience is super-important to me and this place definitely has it all.  One of the negatives is that they're doing construction all over the exits for this mall and they're confused and often backed up all the way to 95.  It's pretty much hell to get in and out during the holidays....but great for a weekday excursion.

I am mostly against karaoke. I have never been a fan, especially when the people take it super seriously. It makes me uncomfortable and a little sad to see someone on the stage, belting out Total Eclipse of the Heart with tears in their eyes. 
But, last night at the Barbary was a different kind of Karaoke. As I walked in the door, there was a man singing I Would Do Anything for Love. Yes, the Meatloaf song. And he was doing quite the job sounding like the one, the only, the man, the myth, the legend. 
The beers were cheap, at $3 for a High Life, I think I can dig. I can dig on this place real hard.

I definitely have a recent "thing" going for gas station restaurants, and as far as they go, this one does not disappoint!  The chef has an impressive pedigree and his food speaks for itself.  Everything is made fresh and very tasty!  I particularly like the salvadorian tamale, stuffed with scrumptious roast pork and steamed in a banana leaf, which makes the masa extra tender and tasty.   Other things I have enjoyed here include the pupusas ($1), tacos, and burrito bowls.  And of course, who doesn't love a self-serve salsa bar with all the tasty treats!

A dog walks into a bar... And takes a seat! 

Love dirty franks! And so does Riley . 

Cheap drafts and low key atmosphere.  Darts and great music. Some old lady once told me "dirty franks is  the greatest bar in Philadelphia with top notch clientele!"

OK, I've been here once and I think I'm going to love this place!  Stopped by just before happy hour and sat at the bar.  I perused the amazing variety of beers.  The bartender was pleasant and knowledgeable.  The only thing better would be if he was the opposite sex and gorgeous.  But hey, you can't have everything!

The place was just starting to fill up.  It was an interesting mix of blue collar, white collar, and the occasional tourist.  There was even a couple sitting at a table with a beautiful Labrador retriever at their feet. 
 
Although I was at the bar, I was watching the wait staff work.  They appeared to be friendly and efficient.  Always a good thing.  

My beers were great.  Yelpers have commented on the fries so I ordered a plate.  I urge you to do the same.  They are really excellent.  The small size was a meal for me.  They have a large.  It scares me to think about it!

I can't wait to come back for more great beer and to try some of the food.

Well, what a gem this is! Happy to find it after our Donut 5k. We were starving from the freezing walk we just completed. There must be a theme when ordering breakfast, because yet again, we started with the cinnamon bun. YUMMO. Also, I just love how you get this little appetizer of granola. It was mighty tasty, reminded me of shortbread. I opted for an omelet and it was very filling and fresh. Our server was very kind and helpful when deciding what to order. It's a little tight when needing to use the facilities, as there is only one and you have to wait in a hallway where the workers are also coming around, but you make do. Super cute!

Their mules are amazing-- especially when they're half off during Mule Monday. I'm a fan of the Mexican Burro and Carribean Seahorse myself. 

As for eats, I've only had their Giant Soft Pretzel- which is awesome with the stone ground mustard!

I love the vibe of this place. It's always poppin'!

Han dynasty used to be one of my go to dinner spots, but when I went earlier tonight I was a little bit disappointed (the Old City location is still great though.)

We ordered cold pork with chili oil, garlic eggplant, dan dan noodles, black bean fish, and fried tofu. The pork belly is awesome and I'd definitely recommend it, and the black bean fish was really flavorful and fresh as well (tons of veggies so my mom was really happy), but I wasn't in love with anything else. The eggplant wasn't as soft or creamy as it has been in the past, the tofu was a bit dry, and there wasn't very much pork in the dan dan noodles. 

The UCity location is still good, just not as great as it was before.

Yea, another vegan restaurant to add to our city.  Those of us animal lovers who like to eat a lot can't be happier!  My husband and I had a nice meal here filled with a veggie burger, sweet potato fries and a delicious cookies, all for a terrific price and right next to the Rotunda where we could see a show. Thanks HCV for coming to west Philly. 

Price is good, parking is limited but go to 41st street where you will almost always get a spot, service is great and the menu is terrific.

Fresh and delicious seafood at the pier, can't leave Santa Barbara without having a meal here. 

The establishment is small, with about 4 tables outside and a few inside with the beach view. And of course there are counter seats facing the open kitchen (best view in my eyes). We were famished by the time we got there so we took the first available seating which was at the counter. We saw how the seafood was hand picked (literally) and prepared.  

Service was very attentive as our orders was taken right away. Food came out fast and the hotel that we stayed at (Milo Hotel) gave us a complimentary clam chowder order for this place, it was definitely put to good use. The clam chowder came in a cup, not in the bread bowl. It was more than enough as an appetizer and tasted so good. For our entrees, we had the Rock Crab Special and the Calamari Sandwich. Both orders came with a side of cole slaw and union rings. I am a big seafood lover so getting my hands dirty for that delicious crab was so well worth it. The crab was a little smaller than expected but super fresh and delicious. The Calamari Sandwich was also good, the seafood quality here is unbelievable for the price. 

I can't wait to come back the next time I'm in SB! Already craving my crab & clam chowder [drools]
I loved this place.  Cool neighborhood, very cool building (looks like a converted mechanic shop).  The cocktails were excellent.

Fantastic list of wine by the glass, especially enjoyed the italian wine that we had: COPERTINO RISERVA, CANTINA SOCIALE COOPERATIVA, '05 (Puglia,Italy)

Solid food. Nothing extraordinary but would recommend the asparagus salad with pine nuts and bruschetta with mushroom and cheese.

the other ones were so-so:
Warm Poached Black Mission Figs with Gorgonzola and Prosciutto di Parma -- Like the proscuitto but didn't love the fig and gorgonzola combination. the sweetness of the fig and the pungent flavor of gorgonzola didn't mix that well.

Truffled Egg Toast with Fontina Fontal -- a bit too heavy on the toast, not as rich as a croque madame. prefer the cheese to be a bit more in quantity, comparing to the toast. could hardly taste the truffle.

Brioche Bread Pudding with Banana, Caramel and Honey Mascarpone- this one is the best. I'm not a dessert person and I even had a couple of bites. Not too heavy, not too sweet, perfect texture of a bit crunchiness on the surface and soft inside. well done.

Iced hazelnut coffee is amazing! Loved it! I have been here many times for crepes and gelato. I love the Nutella crepes and the Nutella gelato.  I also have enjoyed the coconut gelato.  The service is hit or miss. At times wonderful and other times I am shocked at how understaffed this place is.

*Nashville Fall 2012 Review*

Believe the hype, especially if you're visiting or have kiddos. In town for just a few days, it was really important to me to find a minute to see some good friends who have just moved to Nashville. We met here on a Saturday morning at around 10 before my flight. The line was out the door when we arrived. It moved quickly, and we were seated by about 10:25 (3 adults and two kidlets). Once you're in, the food comes quickly, so I was actually thankful for the time spent waiting in line, getting to catch up with my friends before we were elbow deep in pancake goodness.

I had four silver dollar pancakes, two strips of perfectly-made bacon and a scrambled egg. The pancakes were among the best I've ever had, if not the best, and I know from pancakes. There are crayons for kids, as well as some M&M pancakes that were the hit of the party. There aren't so many M&Ms that you run the risk of sugar shock, just enough to add novelty and get picky eaters out of their shell enough to get some calories into little bodies before their Saturday adventures.

A morning with lovely company at a charming place: I won't soon forget my morning at Pancake Pantry.

Do not let the strip mall location fool you, this is a fabulous restaurant. As far as I know, it's the only Peruvian restaurant in the St Louis area.

The decor is simple but pleasant. Nice furniture, warm neutral color scheme, and some pretty metalwork all make you feel like you are leaving the strip mall scene behind when you walk through the door. (You know how it is, when you go to a cheep little restaurant, and you can just *feel* the supermarket two doors down? Mango thankfully manages to block the supermarket aura)

The meal starts out with fried plantain chips instead of bread. They get 5 stars for this alone. I am deeply in love with all fried banana-type foodstuffs.

Our table ordered about half a dozen appetizers, and all I remember is a delicious blur of hot and cold, sweet and spicy, and lots of bright colors. I do remember for sure that the ceviche was excellent. If you've got a group of people, order a bunch to share.

For dinner, I had the seafood special, which was mahi mahi that night (I think). It was served with delicious mashed potatoes (did you  know that Peru has some enormously huge number of native potato species?) and a delicious chunky mango-based sauce. Though I did have tastes of a number of the other entrees, and they were also wonderful. All very different.

Vegetarians take note: They do have vegetarian options. A couple of them even look like they could be ordered without cheese to make them vegan.

For desert, I had the flan. It was great, soft texture, and the sauce was thin like it ought to be (not just regular caramel sauce poured over pudding) Others at my table had the Torta de Chocolat, which was excellent.

Overall, I loved how the food had a very playful combination of sweet, starchy and spicy. One of the people at dinner with us had gone to high school in Peru, and according to her, the flavors were very authentic. She was also very excited to see they had Inca Cola. We had a really wonderful dinner experience, and will definitely be back.

Wow, I love Red Cup! I remember stopping in once when they first opened... menu was limited since they were just starting out. I think it was just coffee and like three types of danishes - something like that. All I can say was it was a sad selection.

They have def gone a long way since then. Ordered a raspberry mocha - so awesome. There were actually pieces of raspberry in my drink. Way better than the sugary syrup stuff! Also had a breakfast bagel - simple and delish - and had a banana nutella crepe. Yum yum! 

I shall be back!

Best shoes on Jasper Ave!! I know that Who Cares is a whole boutique with fabulous dresses, great designer jeans, very cool jewelry and chic clothes. But to me, it is all about the shoes! From Madden to Michael Kors, Stewart Weitzman to House of Harlow... Add some Enzo Angiolini's, Betsy Johnson,Tory Birch and LAMB... Oh, I am in shoe heaven! 

There are always great sales on all the shoes at the end of each season. I have to say, I probably do my most shoe splurges in this store. I love it! Nothing makes you feel better on a bad day then trying on a sexy pump with a sky high stiletto. Nothing rewards you for a job well done better then the next pair of soles that are coming home with you as a constant reminder of that success, to live forever in your closet. Shoes have no calories, they may break their seams but never your heart. The clicking on marble floors announces to all in ear shot "I Am Here, Look At Me!" They start conversations and end an evening with style. Well, I mean, all this is true if you buy your shoes from Who Cares... Cuz if you don't care, who will?

I was able to sample a few things from here last week and nothing was disappointing! The fried spicy mac and cheese ball was hot and melty and totally homemade. I also had the alligator gumbo and I honestly don't think I've had gumbo before, but this was so good I may not want to try it from anywhere else! It was totally spicy, but warm and made me feel so much better on a rainy sick day i was having. 

To top it off I had their bread pudding, which is one of my favorite desserts, and it was  perfect. Warm, gooey, AND it had raisins and apple slices. I absolutely loved it. 

It was also the first time I was in Reading Terminal Market and that was an adventure in itself! I'll definitely be back to try more Southern Comfort food!

This place sparked my love for shrimp and grits! ...and bacon bloody marys. Yes, bacon bloody marys! 

Found this place with my handy Yelp app while wandering around New Orleans and so happy that I did. The inside is quite small so we did have to wait a few minutes for a table but it was definitely worth it. While standing in line I noticed a sign for bacon bloody marys so, of course, I had to try one... or two ;) They were amazing! Made with bacon flavored vodka, the perfect amount of spicy, and loaded with two strips of bacon, picked green beans and peppers. 

Their food menu is also great. Lots of unique items and everything is full of flavor. We ordered the shrimp and grits and pancakes (sweet potato I think). The shrimp and grits were amazing! Seriously, If you only try one thing here, you have to try the shrimp and grits! 

Loved this place so much that I ended up back here the next day... for more bacon bloody marys and shrimp and grits! (Can you tell I liked the shrimp and grits?)

Service is hit or miss, but usually pretty good (sometimes servers are MIA).  I love going at lunchtime for the pasta buffet.  Chef Brian is very personable and remembers what you like!  My favorite combo:  meatballs, sundried tomatoes, mushrooms, spinach, peas, artichokes, and bowtie pasta with the red pepper pesto and marinara.  Can't beat it.  

They would do well to add another pasta line.  It gets really backed up to the point I never bother to try to go on a Friday.  Also, the kind of tea they use is awful.  It always tastes overbrewed.

My husband and I ate here for a quick bite after catching a movie. This place is great. It may seem minor, but there is something to be said about a finding a great burger joint, especially when you don't eat beef! I could immediately tell that the turkey burger I ordered was not a mediocre frozen turkey patty, which is what a lot of those other places serve. It was fresh and grilled, just the way I like it! I had it with a side of sweet potato fries. I loved how you can pick your own toppings from a variety of selections, much like a salad bar. Plus, the prices were affordable. The décor was great and had a nostalgic feel, kind of similar to an old diner. Our interaction with the staff was minimal but no major complaints. It was a perfect lunch date!

Café Ponte was an elegant diversion during the work day.  I was concerned when we showed up and was asked if we had a reservation.  The place was busy and it looked as if a reservation was necessary.  However, with little effort we were seated and enjoyed a wonderful lunch.

The experience at Café Ponte addresses both the taste and the visual.  The dining room is lovely to look at with tables and booths adorned with white table clothes and fine flatware.  Some of the booths have an artistic and participatory feel about them as they are half booths facing the dining room allowing you to look out toward the activity.  There is a beautiful wine cellar that accents tables as the open up into a service/kitchen area that you hardly notice because of the curved lines allowing it to blend in with the interior.  A very beautiful place.

I enjoyed a special for lunch; a beet salad which was as impressive as the interior.  Every component of the salad tasted fresh.  It was huge mounding portion of mixed greens with halves and quarters of yellow and red beets.  There was no need for an additional salad dressing because the way it was prepared was excellent.  Most salads are boring and something I find myself getting solely for dietary reasons.  This salad blended flavors and textures that satisfied and delighted; from the cool leaves of the greens to the crunch of the beets this was a salad that you could not stop eating.  Even what appeared to be croutons was a delightful surprise as it was actually spice bread th complimented the salad so completely that it was genius.  I really enjoyed this salad.

If you are looking for a night out or a special lunch I would recommend this place.  After my visit I would definitely encourage reservations because you would not want to miss out.  I hope to return soon to try other items.

The Irish Pol matters to me for one major reason; I generally hate Olde City. The neighborhood is beautiful, but after dark it becomes a breeding ground for bros and girls trolling for bros. 

However, in the event I'm asked to attend a function at some insipid, overpriced "lounge" with a monosyllabic name I delight in the knowledge that I only have to make an appearance and have one drink before I politely excuse myself and head over to Pol. 

Once there I continue to delight in the wonderful and vast beer selection, the bartenders who know something about everything they have on tap and the bar set-up itself (I love that the taps are on the back wall of the bar.) The music is usually good and the "bros" tend to feel the icy stares of judgement being shot at them and head for the exit post haste.

I'm a big fan of Firebirds...when I lived in Charlotte, I had countless client lunches at their locations throughout the Charlotte area. Quality, tasty food and good service is easy to recognize.

I was pretty jazzed to learn that a Firebirds is here in St. Louis...had lunch with my boss and really enjoyed it. HIGHLY recommend the smokehouse chicken sandwich. Very tasty and don't miss the mixed greens salad...the jicama and pecans are perfect together.

Service with the host was a real miss...she seemed a bit overwhelmed perhaps, it happens. Our waiter was great. Prompt and courteous. Never had to ask for a refill and he barely interrupted our lunch (you know how some folks love to ask if you want a refill as your glass is near empty and you barely started your lunch...OF COURSE I want a refill, LOL). Again, waiter was great. I will certainly be back again...and again. GREAT PLACE.

Great first time experience here! I went here for Sunday brunch recently to see what all the hype was about. I definitely understand it. Food was delicious! 

Arrived around 12:30 to a very busy restaurant. Was told our wait would be about an hour. Luckily my boyfriend wasn't sure what to order so we spent most of the time getting suggestions and looking at pictures, while enjoying some coffee beverages. After an hour we were seated at the bar and placed our orders. I heard great things about the grilled cheese dish and my boyfriend settled with the Dutch pancake with apples. We ordered a side of bacon as well. 

Once the food came out, I dug in and enjoyed every bit of it. The touch of honey on the grilled cheese really brought the flavor together. I loved having the egg on top as well. The bacon - wow. We couldn't even finish all the bacon but I loved it. We both enjoyed our meals. The items on the menu may seem strange to a first timer, but trust that you will be satisfied with anything, so give it a shot. I would love to come back to try more. 

I gave it 4 out of 5 only because I need to try more before giving it the title of "best brunch in Indy", but I was definitely impressed with what I had!

As much as I love Indian food, this place was kind of a disappointment.

I came here during lunch with my intern friend and we both wanted to try this Indian "chipotle" concept. I ordered the rice bowl + chicken, along with some toppings. 

The chicken was dry and bland, and the toppings were not fresh. The owner recommended that I get the crispy chickpea topping. BUT it was not crispy at all, except 2 bites. So, my guess is that those "crispy" toppings were not fresh. The spinach sauce topping was good though, as the owner recommended. I've had better Indian food, and this really does not cut it. Though if you're looking for a quick lunch with protein and veggies, this is worth a try!

This is such a cute place and the owners are so friendly.

Went in with my Groupon for the patio wine tasting.  There were decent pours and cheese and pretzels to snack on. 

I really enjoyed the tasting overall, however, it isn't very cool in the tasting room.  So it can get a little uncomfortable.  

I dig that the majority of bottles are under $15 here and I love supporting the local business.

I recommend anyone to go check it out on a free afternoon.  Just beware, parking can be difficult if they are busy.

I love everything about Whiskey Village except the small space. We were fortunate that after the hostess told us that the wait for a table was close to two hours a couple of seats opened up at the bar.
 
We started off with a couple of amazing cocktails that were expertly prepared (2nd only to Hop Sing), an order of deviled eggs, and the duck fat fried fries covered in a delectable cheese sauce and topped with beef brisket....WOW! We were content but decided to push on and try their famous burgers. I had the special of the house that had a terrific homemade thousand island dressing and my wife had hers topped with foie gras and bacon. Both came out cooked perfectly medium rare surrounded by a very fresh and delicious bun. Even though we were fairly full before the burgers came we ate every bite leaving in a blissful state of food intoxication.
I cannot believe I'm at a KK drive thru!  Who doesn't love a KK donut??

Bubble tea haven! 
If you haven't experienced the addictiveness of bubble tea before this is the best place to start. 
Not sure what to try? Go for one of the top picks- I'm so glad they have that labelled really well now it makes it super easy to experience with new friends. 
But some of my favourite go to choices: sunflower and dream. A couple weird choices you might not think of getting but are SO good: sesame, red bean, and taro (if love purple and sweet totally get a taro). 
Sago and jelly? Don't worry if you don't like these gummy things that make you feel like your chewing your drink just ask them not to put it in. Personally I'm a fan and used to ask for double the amount of both- I've hence lowered that addiction so my bubble tea looks more normal now. 

Dream Tea house off whyte Ave is one of the best locations- with a new Reno this place is beautiful and they have board games you can sign out to play(just make sure you bring ID). 
Parking is good for a couple hours but be cautious they watch the time limits really closely here. 

On a side note this place is busy! Expect a bit of a line but they can seriously pump out the bubble tea's fast! And don't forget t get yourself a stamp card- for every 9 drinks get the 10th one free!

I usually love Harry and Izzy's. I've been going there for years. Unfortunately, the last few visits really put me off. I hope things turn around soon. My favorites are usually the shrimp cocktail and the filet sliders. The shrimp were definitely not fresh and had a bad taste. I've sent them back twice now.  I asked for medium filets and received them very well done on 3 separate occasions. I had to also send back the gritty asparagus. It was filled with sand.  I'm keeping my fingers crossed that the food gets back to where it was. It won't be my last time dinning at Harry and Izzys, but I will ask about the freshness of the food before ordering in the future. Wine selection is always great.

this is precisely why i love yelp.  I am in need of an eye doctor and I search on Yelp and I am VERY satisfied.  My time with Dr Biscardi was not rushed, and she was very attentive to my issues. She recommended a new kind of contacts for me which I am happily using right now. 

Dr. Biscardi is very professional and kind. She is not a product-pusher either; she let me know the prices for lenses at her place but recommended I check online as well.  I highly recommend coming for a visit if you need an eye exam.

Han dynasty has been on my list for a couple of years now. I happened to be extremely famished when driving home from cherry hill and saw Han Dynasty in my peripheral. 

There were a few things that I was told not to skip out on and I'm glad I listened. My mom and I started with dumplings in Chili oil and the dan dan noodles. The dumplings were good, but Dim sum garden in china town is just as good, I think its all about the oil. The dan dan noodles were awesome, highly recommend. We then ordered a dry pot with pork. It was extremely spicy (10). As long as you like heat, you'll love this dish.

The service was great. Our server was extremely knowledgeable. As we were being indecisive per useee, he told us to order a couple items at a time to better gauge our hunger level. 

I def wanna check out the old city or ucity location.

$2.00 (Domestic) Pints on Tuesdays!  $3.50 for their good selection of local/craft beers! 

I wasn't super impressed with the pizza, but I'll give it another shot.  Love the fact that it's tucked away in an alley.. This and the Tuesday beer special will keep me coming back!

I really liked CBP, especially after multiple visits to Nat's stadium.  This place is like heaven!
